article: When I was nine, my family and some friends took a trip. During the trip some members of the group felt _ , so we stopped at a small stand . Everyone lined up to buy their food.  _ , after I finished eating, I was still a little hungry and wanted some _ . Soon I was sure my parents wouldn't _ me any candy. "I have to think of a plan," I thought. Then an old lady _ to buy something she wanted, and would have to get back in line. I knew what I could do. So I rushed to her and volunteered my _ . She _ and gave me a $20 bill to get some chips. When I reached the stand, I found _ from our group was around. Then I spent the _ $20 buying the candy. I thought _ , "I have almost bought all the candy for the next century!" But then, I _ I should explain to the old lady why I bought no chips and where the whole bill had gone. _ , an idea occurred to me. So I shouted, "I was robbed!" Upon _ this, the old lady rushed to me to see if I _ any harm. However, my parents just stayed behind, without any _ . With so much candy being found in my bag, they knew I was _ ! When my daddy stared at me angrily, I knew I had to tell the _ . As a result, I was blamed and had to apologize to the old lady for my _ action. Later, I had to work during the whole summer holiday to _ the old lady back that $20. From this _ , I learned a lesson. I also promised that I would never do it again in the future.
